body.p: Defines a new text search dictionary.
body.codeblock: CREATE TEXT SEARCH DICTIONARY name ( TEMPLATE = template [, option = value [, ... ]] )

section.title: Description
section.p: CREATE TEXT SEARCH DICTIONARY creates a new text search dictionary. A text search dictionary specifies a way of recognizing interesting or uninteresting words for searching. A dictionary depends on a text search template, which specifies the functions that actually perform the work. Typically the dictionary provides some options that control the detailed behavior of the template's functions.
If a schema name is given then the text search dictionary is created in the specified schema. Otherwise it is created in the current schema.
The user who defines a text search dictionary becomes its owner.

section.title: Parameters

plentry.pd: The name of the text search dictionary to be created. The name can be schema-qualified.
The name of the text search template that will define the basic behavior of this dictionary.
The name of a template-specific option to be set for this dictionary.
The value to use for a template-specific option. If the value is not a simple identifier or number, it must be quoted (but you can always quote it, if you wish).

section.p: The options can appear in any order.

section.p: There is no CREATE TEXT SEARCH DICTIONARY statement in the SQL standard.
